column4: I just changed the hostname of a box I'm SSH'd into by changing /etc/hostname. I plan on rebooting the machine and then SSH'ing back into it. Will I have any problems doing that, or will the hostname change cause problems with key negotiation?
why reboot? You can use the hostname command to change the hostname as well
True, but this machine isn't on a UPS and will end up being rebooted eventually anyway. I just want to make sure I can SSH into it when it does.
